tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review:
The doctor is straight forward and checks medical history and provides medicines as required.
I had went with my  MIL for her chest pain issue . She was suggested tests which were carried out in Indigo hospital itself. The facility is good.She is feeling fine after taking medicines and all.
But,she had history of low sodium level and she was hospitalised for same reason before. 
The sodium check report was yet to come and we were  assured that it would be shared on whatsapp .
We anyways had appointment a day after with another specialist  in same hospital and we thought if sodium Level issue is there then we will get it on WhatsApp and we can take a call to visit our old doctor if required in between before the appointment.
But we were told to collect report from the hospital itself and Indigo hospital didn't shared report on WhatsApp.
I found it to be weired because now we cannot do anything till we actually receive the report.

tags: None
review: I had chest pain around heart region. I was made to do ECG, Tropnin Test and 2D Echo. While doing 2D Echo, I was unable to turn myself due to pain after which doctor said that if the pain is so much then it cannot be a heart attack pain and is a muscular pain. He prescribed a painkiller. I made to pay 5K due to all tests which were irrelevant.
reply_text:
Thank you for the feedback.
Along with the clinical judgement, to rule out the cardiac cause for the chest pain, tests like ECG, Trop T and Echo are advised. In your case, fortunately these tests were normal and your pain was more during movements, hence you were advised painkillers and not angiography. These tests are lifesavers in certain subset of patients.
As a part of protocol, you were informed about the charges before the tests and after your consent, you were taken up for the tests. 
We hope you are better. Wishing for your speedy recovery.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
The admin staff at Mulund premises does not know how to deal with patients
After 2D echo we were told that the admin staff would guide us further. 

The admin staff did not explain anything and only when we enquired what should be done further they mentioned that you have to take medicines and come for 2nd visit

Kindly train the admin staff or replace them. These admin staff will negate all the goodness the doctor has

tags: Doctor friendliness,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
* Doctor has never advised me on what food, oil, etc I must take / avoid.

* I had to ask the technician who gave me good and practical tips.

* Suggest regarding what to take and avoid, if we can be given typed readymade notes.

* When taking appointment over the phone, operator must be friendly and must show concern and must revert back if Dr. is not available. They must suggest alternative dates which will help. This is not being done. 

* Suggest to tie up with a medical store at Saidam for 10-15% discount. Inform Patients to go there to avail the discount through Dr.recommondation. Patients will feel happy.

* Dr. must tell Patients that of they have missed appointment at Mulund then if convenient, they can come on the evening to Bhandup too

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
My experience with Dr Ashish was excellent. He explained all my concerns to my satisfaction. He was very sincere with his observations and advise. He never frightened me by exaggerating my illness issues (which I had experienced earlier).
Thanks to Dr Ashish. I would definitely visit you for any further treatment and also recommend others.
Infact all his staff members were very customer centric and helpful.
However one humble request, is to consider some concession when a patient approaches directly, without reference from any other Doctor, whom he has to pay some incentive.

review: Last 2 years plus...I am treated by Dr Ashish for my second heart attack & subsequent angioplasty...& then follow ups & reviews...I find him extremely approachable...easy to talk to very patient & understanding...explains rational behind treatment  & makes you feel relaxed & you feel that you are being treated by a competent authority.

tags: None
review: My experience was very good. Doctor enquired about my detailed history, did all the necessary test and told me that I am absolutely fine. Looking at my ECG (which was done routinely), I was told by someone that I have some major issue in my heart. Me and my family were very much worried but all Thanks to Agrawal sir that he relived all our stress and told that my ECG was the normal wrand. So, nothing to worry as of now. I will strongly recommend him.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I have been only once but Dr really performs Miracles 
He is well specialised in Heart ailments and prescribes minimum medicines. 
Very down to earth and replies on wats up for queries which is the rarest of the rare. 
If there is no need, Dr will never tell you to visit again. 
A thorough professional as he is, He has carved his own niche in field of Cardiology. 
God bless him for his Yeoman services to the Society. 
Dr is very reasonable in his fees. An asset to mankind
